text: In this example, we will create an Amazon CloudWatch alarm
for an Auto Scaling policy that scales out the number of EC2 instances.
The CloudWatch alarm alerts the application with this threshold is reached.
At the top of the AWS Management Console, click the Amazon CloudWatch tab.
In the Navigation pane, select US East (Virginia) from the region dropdown menu.
Click Create Alarm.
On the Select Metric page of the Create Alarm Wizard,
select EC2 Aggregated by Auto-Scaling Group.
Type in your Auto Scaling group, myautoscalinggroup.
Click Search.
Here we will select the row where it says myautoscalinggroup and CPU Utilization.
Click Continue.
Next, we will define the alarm.
On the Define Alarm of the Create Alarm Wizard,
type myhighcpualarm in the name box,
then type a description for this alarm.
In the Define Alarm Threshold section, select Greater Than,
type 60 for 60 percent, and then 10 for 10 minutes.
This means that if your CPU utilization exceeds 60% for longer than 10 minutes,
it will trigger an alarm.
Click Continue.
In the Configure Actions page of the Create Alarm Wizard,
select Alarm from the When Alarm State Is dropdown menu.
Select Auto Scaling Policy from the Take Action dropdown menu.
Next, select your Auto Scaling group from the Auto Scaling Group dropdown menu,
and then select the policy that you created.
In this example, we used myscaleuppolicy.
Click Add Action.
You can also use Simple Notification Service
to send email notifications to yourself.
Select Alarm from the When Alarm State Is dropdown box.
In the Take Action dropdown box, select Send Notification.
Create a new email topic and type in your email address.
Then click Add Action.
Click Continue.
Review your alarm settings, and click Create Alarm.
Click Close.
The confirmation dialog box closes, returning you to the CloudWatch page.
Your new alarm now appears in the list.
When you create your myscaledown policy,
you can create another alarm using the same steps.
For more information about Amazon CloudWatch, see the Amazon CloudWatch Developer Guide.
